p: EDITable provides a self-service platform that helps you manage reference data for your reporting & planning applications in Power BI. It complements your Master Data Management (MDM) solution and offers a lightweight alternative for business users that supports both reference data (such as customer, region, and product master) and flat tables (such as price list, contracts, projects, and discounts).

h2: Power Your Planning Applications Using EDITable
p: EDITable ensures that you have full control over master data supporting your planning applications. Be it products, regions, accounts, cost centers, customers, employees, or salaries - you can maintain everything with ease to ensure the integrity of your plans and forecasts.
EDITable makes it much easier to incorporate forward-looking master data that is needed for planning, especially master data that is not yet created in your transaction systems or data warehouses.
h2: EDITable vs. Other Matrix Visuals with Writeback
p: Discover how EDITable is different from other matrix visuals with writeback capabilities:

ul.li: Data Store: A matrix visual typically consumes data from Table A, and writes back data to Table B. With EDITable, the source & destination tables are (must be) the same as you are working on reference data (which can used by multiple other applications).
Connectivity: A matrix visual typically supports both Import and DirectQuery modes. EDITable can only consume DirectQuery (Live) connections.
Data Type: A matrix visual typically allows you to update measures; EDITable can be used to update both dimensions & measures.
Sample Use Cases: Matrix products are best suited for planning and forecasting applications; EDITable works well for maintaining reference data and flat tables such as price lists, vendor lists, etc.
Structure: Matrix products work well with hierarchical data; EDITable exclusively supports flat (non-hierarchical) tables, and offers support for slowly changing dimensions (SCD Type II).
